valid_articles.Title: Google "from this image" image search refinement
valid_articles.Description: Google has updated its image search with a "from this image" refinement feature.

valid_articles.Title: Summer 2024: Affiliate and SEO analysis of US online gambling market
valid_articles.Description: Online Gambling Quarterly provides a segment-specific breakdown of US online gambling operators' affiliate and SEO activities

valid_articles.Title: Snapchat's Adding Sponsored Snaps to Expands Its Ad Opportunities
valid_articles.Description: Snapchat is adding sponsored snaps to its platform, expanding its advertising opportunities. The sponsored snaps will appear in the chat inbox as a new snap without a push notification, and opening the message is optional.

valid_articles.Title: Google August 2024 core update is done
valid_articles.Description: Google's August 2024 core update is complete, and few websites saw full recoveries. Some experienced small recoveries, but most saw no change or even further declines. The update's impact is analyzed with volatility charts and insights from the SEO community.

valid_articles.Title: Sites surging or dropping AFTER the Google August 2024 core update
valid_articles.Description: Observations on how websites are performing after the completion of Google's August 2024 core update. Some sites are continuing to surge or drop in rankings, and the fluctuations are being monitored closely.

valid_articles.Title: Google's Handling of Canonical Tags
valid_articles.Description: A recent test revealed that Google might completely ignore canonical tags in certain situations. This finding, based on a Google documentation update, highlights the importance of careful canonical tag implementation.

valid_articles.Title: Circle to Search adds song finder and Gemini-powered TalkBack coming
valid_articles.Description: Circle to Search, a search tool, is getting an upgrade with a new song finder feature and upcoming Gemini-powered TalkBack functionality.

valid_articles.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update Done Rolling Out
valid_articles.Description: The Google August 2024 core update finished rolling out yesterday at around 3 pm ET. It took over 19 days to roll out, starting on August 15th at 11 am and finishing on September 3rd at 3 pm. The update was expected to take a month but ended up taking less than 3 weeks to roll out.

valid_articles.Title: Google updates its canonical documentation to say "Don't specify a fragment URL as canonical, as Google generally doesn't support fragment URLs."
valid_articles.Description: Google updates its canonical documentation to say "Don't specify a fragment URL as canonical, as Google generally doesn't support fragment URLs."

valid_articles.Title: Madison and Wall forecast $397 billion in 2024 ad spend
valid_articles.Description: However, despite their rhetoric, marketers are emphasizing 'performance' over quality content.

valid_articles.Title: SEO poisoning and VPN spoofing used to target anything and everything with WikiLoader malware
valid_articles.Description: Palo Alto saw its VPN tool being spoofed to spread malware

valid_articles.Title: Attention metrics step forward in guidelines — as their value is questioned
valid_articles.Description: The burgeoning field of attention metrics, which has made some progress in being used by more publishers, brands and agencies in the pursuit of reaching consumers more effectively, has to be happy about the fact that accreditation could bring an added level of legitimacy to their offerings.

valid_articles.Title: Google's August Core Update Rollout Completed
valid_articles.Description: Google confirms the August core update has finished rolling out, taking 19 days to complete.

valid_articles.Title: Tips for Internal and External Page Links
valid_articles.Description: Links remain critical to search engine optimization despite confusion and suggestions otherwise.

valid_articles.Title: September 2024 Google Webmaster Report: August Core Update, AI Overviews Updates & Monopoly Ruling
valid_articles.Description: It finally happened, we got a new core update, the Google August 2024 core update touched down on August 15th. It resulted in some movement with some sites hit by the September helpful content update and also many sad stories, including many sites that were hit.

valid_articles.Title: YouTube Algorithm & SEO Questions Answered
valid_articles.Description: A few months ago, we posted some answers about how YouTube ranking is affected by various variables and factors - YouTube SEO questions and answers, if you will. Well, the YouTube Liaison posted a number of short video answers around the YouTube algorithm and YouTube SEO over the past week that I wanted to share.

valid_articles.Title: Bing Knowledge Panel & Featured Snippet Table Of Contents Animation
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft recently added an animation or highlight effect on its featured answers or knowledge panels at the top of its Bing Search results. When you hover your mouse over the table of content on the left side, the section it corresponds to in the answer, will expand.

valid_articles.Title: Googler's Tip About Favicons Can Make A Big Difference
valid_articles.Description: Google's John Mueller offered a tip for optimizing favicons that isn't officially documented but could improve their impact

valid_articles.Title: How publishers are experimenting with Reddit — even without a formal publisher program
valid_articles.Description: While it hasn’t formally launched a publisher program, over the last 18 months Reddit has been steadily rolling out products and resources aimed at courting media companies to increase their presence on the platform.

valid_articles.Title: Marketing Briefing: Why holding companies are taking a 'platform' approach to pitch more cohesively

valid_articles.Title: CMO Strategies: eBay, Hyundai, Duolingo and other advertisers share key tactics for marketing channels
valid_articles.Description: This is a bonus behind-the-scenes look at our conversations with executives for Digiday's CMO Strategies series. In this report, Hyundai, eBay, Duolingo and other advertisers share their current marketing strategies within four key media channels: social media, retail media, display ads and ad-supported streaming.

valid_articles.Title: Why Sam’s Club's ad platform is banking on member data to attract advertisers
valid_articles.Description: With an estimated 600 locations in the U.S., size and scale are what Sam’s Club Member Access Platform (MAP), the company’s retail access and ad platform, is banking on to draw in advertisers.

valid_articles.Title: The cases for and against the CMO role
valid_articles.Description: The answer depends on your vantage point. Gap is bringing back the CMO role after a two-year break, while Hyundai is choosing to phase it out. With the CMO under the spotlight once more, let’s dive into the pros and cons to see why a top marketer can be an invaluable asset for some companies and an outdated figurehead for others. The case for CMOs For many CEOs, a CMO is the not-so secret weapon in their arsenal, driving the profit that fuels growth. This isn’t just lip service from a trade publication -- recent earnings reports have shown just how crucial these marketing execs are. CEOs from PepsiCo, Gap, Unilever, Procter & Gamble, General Mills, and Nestlé have all given a nod to marketing—and by extension, their CMOs—as the driving force behind their financial triumphs this quarter. Nike’s CEO extolled “impactful storytelling” and “brand distinction”—a.k.a. cranking up brand ads. General Mills’ chief raved about brand reinforcement, while Levi’s CEO name-dropped Beyoncé and lauded

valid_articles.Title: “Is SEO Dead?” Why AI Isn’t the End of Law Firm Marketing
valid_articles.Description: With the emergence of Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology, many business owners have feared that marketing as we know it is coming to an end. After all, Google Gemini is routinely surfacing AI-generated responses over organic search results, AI content is abundant, and AI-driven tools are being used more than ever to automate tasks previously performed by human marketers.

valid_articles.Title: What are the results of putting into practice the advice of 'AI optimization (AIO)' that modifies the output of AI like SEO?
valid_articles.Description: Due to the decline in search accuracy caused by search engine optimization (SEO) and the development of AI, an increasing number of Internet users are turning to chatbots rather than search engines to find information. The New York Times reported on the results of a user following the instructions of a startup that specializes in 'artificial intelligence optimization (AIO),' which conveniently alters the evaluations of people and products output by AI. How I Improved My Tainted Reputation With Chatbots - The New York Times https://www.nytimes.com/2024/08/30/technology/ai-chatbot-chatgpt-manipulation.htm  According to Kevin Roos, a columnist for The New York Times, when he asks about the reputation of Google's Gemini and others, he is often portrayed as if he is anti-AI. valid_articles.Title: Media Buying Briefing: Why indie agency Langrand tilts against consultancies, rather than fellow agencies, to help clients transform
valid_articles.Description: Houston-based Langrand pits itself against the consultancies of the world — the McKinseys and Accentures and BCGs — as much as it does other agencies.

valid_articles.Title: What do advertisers want from Tubi in the U.K.?

valid_articles.Description: New state laws and new tools from cybersecurity firms both aim to help mitigate the risks of AI content and deepfakes in this election season.

valid_articles.Title: Digiday+ Research: Pinterest surpasses X when it comes to brands' usage of UGC-focused social platforms
valid_articles.Description: X has historically been dominant among UGC-focused social platforms, but Digiday+ Research surveys have found that, this year, Pinterest has passed X in brand usage for the first time — and brand and retailer ad spend on Pinterest is higher than on X, too.
